message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the construction of locally decodable codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The codes are based on expander graphs, which are a fundamental object in theoretical computer science (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the use of finite geometries in the construction of the codes, which is a topic in computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper involves the analysis of the error-correcting capabilities of the codes, which is a topic in complexity theory (cs.CC) and cryptography (cs.CR).
